cellularAutomata.mac
Class MacOSHandler

java.lang.Object
  cellularAutomata.mac.MacOSHandler

public class MacOSHandler
extends java.lang.Object

Handles all Mac specific code, like system properties and menu features.

Author:
David Bahr

Constructor Summary
MacOSHandler()
           
 
Method Summary
static void setMacOSXSpecificFeatures()
          Handles features required by Mac OS X (in particular Mac OS X has a specific way of dealing with Quit and About menus that Mac users will expect to see).
static void setMacSpecificSystemProperties()
          Set system properties specific to the Mac operating system.

Constructor Detail

MacOSHandler

public MacOSHandler()
Method Detail

setMacOSXSpecificFeatures

public static void setMacOSXSpecificFeatures()
Handles features required by Mac OS X (in particular Mac OS X has a specific way of dealing with Quit and About menus that Mac users will expect to see).

setMacSpecificSystemProperties

public static void setMacSpecificSystemProperties()
Set system properties specific to the Mac operating system. This MUST be called before any GUI components. The CA code works without these system properties, but without these properties the CA will have a "Swing" look instead of the "Mac" look that mac users expect.

Note that it does not hurt other OS's to have these properties set.
